feature: MQTT Integration with Home Assistant Auto-Discovery
workflow_rationale: New module development for MQTT integration. Follows feature workflow: Core implementation → Discovery → Publishing → Testing

phases.name: MQTT Client Core
phases.description: Implement basic MQTT client with connection management, callbacks, and reconnect logic

subtasks.description: Create MQTTClient class with initialization and connection lifecycle

verification.command: python -c "from src.mqtt_client import MQTTClient; from src.config import MQTTConfig; print('OK')"

subtasks.notes: Created MQTTClient class with initialization, connection lifecycle structure, and callback system placeholders. Implemented graceful import handling for asyncio-mqtt. All method signatures defined per spec. Verification passed.

subtasks.description: Implement connect() and disconnect() methods with connection state tracking

verification.instructions: Verify connect() and disconnect() methods are async and handle connection state properly. Code review to ensure proper error handling.

subtasks.notes: Implemented async connect() and disconnect() methods with proper connection state tracking. Features include: LWT (Last Will Testament) for offline state, online/offline availability publishing with retain flag, graceful disconnect with reconnection task cancellation, callback trigger support (sync/async), comprehensive error handling and logging. Connection state tracked via _connected flag. Verified with manual code review and syntax check.

subtasks.description: Implement callback system (on_connect, on_disconnect) and reconnect logic

verification.instructions: Verify callback registration works and reconnect logic triggers on disconnect

subtasks.notes: Implemented callback registration system and automatic reconnect logic. Features: on_connect() and on_disconnect() methods for callback registration with duplicate prevention, automatic reconnection with exponential backoff (1s to 60s max), _should_reconnect flag to control auto-reconnect behavior, support for both sync and async callbacks, reconnect task cancellation on intentional disconnect. Verified with comprehensive test suite covering callback registration, invocation, and reconnect logic structure.

phases.name: Home Assistant Auto-Discovery
phases.description: Implement HA MQTT auto-discovery protocol for automatic entity creation

subtasks.description: Create discovery payload builders for binary_sensor (motion)

verification.command: python -c "from src.mqtt_client import MQTTClient; c = MQTTClient.__new__(MQTTClient); import json; p = c._build_binary_sensor_discovery(); assert 'device_class' in p and p['device_class'] == 'motion'; print('OK')"

subtasks.notes: Follow HA MQTT discovery format: {name, unique_id, state_topic, device_class, device}. Use spec.md discovery payload as reference.

subtasks.description: Create discovery payload builders for sensors (threat_level, confidence, last_analysis)

verification.command: python -c "from src.mqtt_client import MQTTClient; c = MQTTClient.__new__(MQTTClient); payloads = [c._build_threat_sensor_discovery(), c._build_confidence_sensor_discovery(), c._build_analysis_sensor_discovery()]; assert all('state_topic' in p for p in payloads); print('OK')"

subtasks.notes: Create separate methods for each sensor type. Include proper units and icons where applicable.

subtasks.description: Implement publish_discovery() method to send all discovery configs

verification.instructions: Verify publish_discovery() sends discovery messages to correct topics with retain=True flag

subtasks.notes: Topics: homeassistant/{component}/{device_id}/{entity}/config. Use QoS from config. Set retain=True for discovery messages.

phases.name: State Publishing
phases.description: Implement state publishing for motion events and analysis results

subtasks.description: Implement publish_motion() to publish motion state and analysis

verification.instructions: Verify publish_motion() publishes to all relevant topics (motion state, threat_level, confidence, last_analysis)

subtasks.notes: Accept detected:bool and optional analysis:AnalysisResult. Publish to multiple topics: motion/state (ON/OFF), threat_level/state, confidence/state, last_analysis/state. Note: AnalysisResult will come from task 05-llm-vision dependency.

subtasks.description: Implement publish_state() for generic state publishing

verification.instructions: Verify publish_state() can publish arbitrary JSON to topic_prefix/topic

subtasks.notes: Generic method for publishing any state dict. Use for custom topics beyond standard entities.

subtasks.description: Implement Last Will Testament (LWT) for availability tracking

verification.instructions: Verify LWT is set during connect with topic: smart_motion/availability, payload: offline

subtasks.notes: Set LWT during connection. Publish 'online' after successful connect. LWT will automatically publish 'offline' on disconnect.

phases.name: Testing and Verification
phases.description: Create comprehensive tests for MQTT client functionality

subtasks.description: Create unit tests with mock MQTT broker
subtasks.notes: Use pytest with asyncio support. Mock asyncio_mqtt.Client. Test: connection, discovery payloads, state publishing, callbacks, reconnect logic.

subtasks.description: Add integration test documentation for real broker testing

verification.instructions: Verify README.md contains instructions for testing with real Mosquitto broker

subtasks.notes: Document how to test with real MQTT broker (docker run mosquitto, connect to it, verify messages). Not automated due to external dependency.

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential execution required due to dependencies
parallelism.reasoning: Each phase depends on the previous phase. Phase 2 needs core client (Phase 1). Phase 3 needs discovery setup (Phase 2). Phase 4 needs all features implemented (Phase 3).

acceptance_criteria: MQTTClient class implements all required methods from spec
Discovery payloads follow HA MQTT discovery protocol
State publishing works for all entity types
LWT (Last Will Testament) is configured correctly
Unit tests pass with mocked broker
Code follows existing async patterns (retry_async, RateLimiter)

verification_steps.name: Code Pattern Compliance
verification_steps.command: grep -q 'get_logger' src/mqtt_client.py && grep -q 'async def' src/mqtt_client.py && echo 'OK'

verification_strategy.reasoning: Medium risk: New integration with external system (MQTT broker) but well-defined protocol. Unit tests required to verify logic. Integration tests documented but not automated due to external dependencies. No security scanning needed as this handles published data only.

integration_tests.notes: Integration tests require external MQTT broker. Documented in tests/integration/README.md for manual verification.

checks: Discovery messages published to correct topics with retain=True
State messages published with correct QoS
